overview.tax_residency_rules: Based on domicile or physical presence for more than 183 days in a tax year.
overview.tax_filing_frequency: Annually by April 30th for individuals and businesses.

personal_income_tax.foreign_income_taxed: Yes, on a territorial basis with the foreign tax credit method.
personal_income_tax.exemptions: Tax-free income includes some social benefits, education allowances, and certain types of bonuses.
personal_income_tax.social_security: 10% of salary (shared between employer and employee).

corporate_tax.foreign_income_taxed: Yes, on a territorial basis with the foreign tax credit method.
corporate_tax.deductions: Business expenses, depreciation, and certain tax credits.

capital_gains_tax.exemptions: Gains from the sale of primary residence are exempt up to a certain amount.

vat_gst.exemptions: Certain basic necessities, healthcare, and education.

property_tax.exemptions: Primary residence up to a certain value.

inheritance_tax.rate: Up to 25% on inherited assets, depending on the relationship to the deceased.

digital_nomad_visa.requirements: Must have a stable source of income from outside Chile and meet certain insurance and visa requirements.
digital_nomad_visa.tax_benefits: Can apply for a special tax regime that exempts foreign-sourced income from Chilean taxes.
digital_nomad_visa.duration: Up to 2 years, with the possibility of renewal.

special_economic_zones.name: Zona Franca de Iquique (ZOFRI)
special_economic_zones.tax_incentives: 100% exemption on corporate tax and VAT.

additional_notes.political_risks: Chile has a stable political environment with strong institutions.
additional_notes.economic_stability: Chile has a relatively stable economy with low inflation and a strong currency.
